author: Paul Hollywood
method: Mix all ingredients, apart from the olives and tomatoes, in a large bowl. Take care not to put the yeast in direct contact with the salt when they are first added to the bowl. Knead well with your hands and knuckles until the dough is elastic, smooth and shiny. Cover with a piece of cling film and leave to rise for one hour. Divide the dough into two and add half of the olives and sun-dried tomatoes into each. Mould both the doughs into rough round shapes and press firmly down. Sprinkle white flour lightly over the top and mark them with a cross. Place them on a baking sheet lined with baking paper (silicone paper) and prove for one hour in a warm place. Bake at 220C/425F/Gas 7 for 30 minutes until golden-brown. Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack.
ingredients: 500g/1lb 2oz strong white flour,  15g/½oz salt,  55ml/2fl oz olive oil,  20g/¾oz fresh yeast,  275ml/9fl oz water,  170g/6oz black Greek olives, pitted and chopped   ,  55g/2oz sun-dried tomatoes
